Enum.name: SEC_2
Enum.description: MCU security status is unsecure

Enum.name: SEC_3
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: FSLACC_2
Enum.description: Freescale factory access denied

Enum.name: FSLACC_3
Enum.description: Freescale factory access granted

Enum.name: MEEN_2
Enum.description: Mass erase is disabled

Enum.name: MEEN_3
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_2
Enum.description: Backdoor key access enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_3
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled

Enum.name: LPBOOT_0
Enum.description: Low-power boot

Enum.name: LPBOOT_1
Enum.description: Normal boot

Enum.name: BOOTPIN_OPT_0
Enum.description: Force Boot from ROM if BOOTCFG0 asserted, where BOOTCFG0 is the boot config function which is muxed with NMI pin

Enum.name: BOOTPIN_OPT_1
Enum.description: Boot source configured by FOPT (BOOTSRC_SEL) bits

Enum.name: NMI_DIS_0
Enum.description: NMI interrupts are always blocked

Enum.name: NMI_DIS_1
Enum.description: NMI_b pin/interrupts reset default to enabled

Enum.name: RESET_PIN_CFG_0
Enum.description: RESET pin is disabled following a POR and cannot be enabled as reset function

Enum.name: RESET_PIN_CFG_1
Enum.description: RESET_b pin is dedicated

Enum.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_0
Enum.description: Boot from Flash

Enum.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_2
Enum.description: Boot from ROM

Enum.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_3
Enum.description: Boot from ROM

Enum.name: EDBG_0
Enum.description: When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.

Enum.name: EDBG_1
Enum.description: When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.

Enum.name: ERCA_0
Enum.description: Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection .

Enum.name: ERCA_1
Enum.description: Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection .

Enum.name: HOE_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: HOE_1
Enum.description: Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.

Enum.name: HALT_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: HALT_1
Enum.description: Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.

Enum.name: CLM_0
Enum.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

Enum.name: CLM_1
Enum.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.

Enum.name: EMLM_0
Enum.description: Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

Enum.name: EMLM_1
Enum.description: Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.

Enum.name: ECX_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: ECX_1
Enum.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.

Enum.name: CX_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: CX_1
Enum.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.

Enum.name: ACTIVE_0
Enum.description: eDMA is idle.

Enum.name: ACTIVE_1
Enum.description: eDMA is executing a channel.

Enum.name: DBE_0
Enum.description: No destination bus error

Enum.name: DBE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write

Enum.name: SBE_0
Enum.description: No source bus error

Enum.name: SBE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read

Enum.name: SGE_0
Enum.description: No scatter/gather configuration error

Enum.name: SGE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.

Enum.name: NCE_0
Enum.description: No NBYTES/CITER configuration error

Enum.name: NCE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]

Enum.name: DOE_0
Enum.description: No destination offset configuration error

Enum.name: DOE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

Enum.name: DAE_0
Enum.description: No destination address configuration error

Enum.name: DAE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

Enum.name: SOE_0
Enum.description: No source offset configuration error

Enum.name: SOE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

Enum.name: SAE_0
Enum.description: No source address configuration error.

Enum.name: SAE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

BitField.name: ERRCHN
BitField.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

Enum.name: CPE_0
Enum.description: No channel priority error

Enum.name: CPE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities . Channel priorities are not unique.

Enum.name: ECX_0
Enum.description: No canceled transfers

Enum.name: ECX_1
Enum.description: The last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

BitField.name: VLD
BitField.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

Enum.name: VLD_0
Enum.description: No ERR bits are set.

Enum.name: VLD_1
Enum.description: At least one ERR bit is set indicating a valid error exists that has not been cleared.

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

BitField.name: MGSTAT0
BitField.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

Enum.name: FPVIOL_0
Enum.description: No protection violation detected

Enum.name: FPVIOL_1
Enum.description: Protection violation detected

Enum.name: ACCERR_0
Enum.description: No access error detected

Enum.name: ACCERR_1
Enum.description: Access error detected

Enum.name: RDCOLERR_0
Enum.description: No collision error detected

Enum.name: RDCOLERR_1
Enum.description: Collision error detected

Enum.name: CCIF_0
Enum.description: FTFE command or EEPROM file system operation in progress

Enum.name: CCIF_1
Enum.description: FTFE command or EEPROM file system operation has completed

BitField.name: EEERDY
BitField.description: This flag indicates if the EEPROM backup data has been copied to the FlexRAM and is therefore available for read access

Enum.name: EEERDY_0
Enum.description: FlexRAM is not available for EEPROM operation

Enum.name: EEERDY_1
Enum.description: FlexRAM is available for EEPROM operations where: reads from the FlexRAM return data previously written to the FlexRAM in EEPROM mode and writes launch an EEPROM operation to store the written data in the FlexRAM and EEPROM backup

Enum.name: RAMRDY_0
Enum.description: FlexRAM is not available for traditional RAM access

Enum.name: RAMRDY_1
Enum.description: FlexRAM is available as traditional RAM only; writes to the FlexRAM do not trigger EEPROM operations

Enum.name: PFLSH_0
Enum.description: FTFE configuration supports one program flash block and one FlexNVM block

Enum.name: ERSSUSP_0
Enum.description: No suspend requested

Enum.name: ERSSUSP_1
Enum.description: Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution

Enum.name: ERSAREQ_0
Enum.description: No request or request complete

Enum.name: ERSAREQ_1
Enum.description: Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state

Enum.name: RDCOLLIE_0
Enum.description: Read collision error interrupt disabled

Enum.name: RDCOLLIE_1
Enum.description: Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever an FTFE read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).

Enum.name: CCIE_0
Enum.description: Command complete interrupt disabled

Enum.name: CCIE_1
Enum.description: Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.

Enum.name: SEC_0
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: SEC_1
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: SEC_2
Enum.description: MCU security status is unsecure (The standard shipping condition of the FTFE is unsecure.)

Enum.name: SEC_3
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: FSLACC_0
Enum.description: Factory access granted

Enum.name: FSLACC_1
Enum.description: Factory access denied

Enum.name: FSLACC_2
Enum.description: Factory access denied

Enum.name: FSLACC_3
Enum.description: Factory access granted

Enum.name: MEEN_0
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: MEEN_1
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: MEEN_2
Enum.description: Mass erase is disabled

Enum.name: MEEN_3
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_0
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_1
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled (preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access)

Enum.name: KEYEN_2
Enum.description: Backdoor key access enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_3
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Triggering is disabled. If triggering is disabled and ENBL is set, the DMA Channel will simply route the specified source to the DMA channel. (Normal mode)

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Triggering is enabled. If triggering is enabled and ENBL is set, the DMAMUX is in Periodic Trigger mode.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: DMA channel is disabled. This mode is primarily used during configuration of the DMAMux. The DMA has separate channel enables/disables, which should be used to disable or reconfigure a DMA channel.

Enum.name: MEN_1
Enum.description: Module is enabled.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Master logic is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Master logic is reset.

Enum.name: DOZEN_0
Enum.description: Module is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEN_1
Enum.description: Module is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_0
Enum.description: Module is disabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_1
Enum.description: Module is enabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: RTF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RTF_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: RRF_0

Enum.name: RRF_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: TDF_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not requested.

Enum.name: TDF_1
Enum.description: Transmit data is requested.

Enum.name: RDF_0
Enum.description: Receive Data is not ready.

Enum.name: RDF_1
Enum.description: Receive data is ready.

Enum.name: WCF_0
Enum.description: Transfer word not completed.

Enum.name: WCF_1
Enum.description: Transfer word completed.

Enum.name: FCF_0
Enum.description: Frame transfer has not completed.

Enum.name: FCF_1
Enum.description: Frame transfer has completed.

Enum.name: TCF_0
Enum.description: All transfers have not completed.

Enum.name: TCF_1
Enum.description: All transfers have completed.

Enum.name: TEF_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO underrun has not occurred.

Enum.name: TEF_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO underrun has occurred

Enum.name: REF_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO has not overflowed.

Enum.name: REF_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO has overflowed.

Enum.name: DMF_0
Enum.description: Have not received matching data.

Enum.name: DMF_1
Enum.description: Have received matching data.

Enum.name: MBF_0
Enum.description: LPSPI is idle.

Enum.name: MBF_1
Enum.description: LPSPI is busy.

Enum.name: TDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled

Enum.name: RDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: WCIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: WCIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: FCIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: FCIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TEIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TEIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: REIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: REIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled

Enum.name: RDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: HREN_0
Enum.description: Host request is disabled.

Enum.name: HREN_1
Enum.description: Host request is enabled.

Enum.name: HRPOL_0
Enum.description: Active low.

Enum.name: HRPOL_1
Enum.description: Active high.

Enum.name: HRSEL_0
Enum.description: Host request input is pin LPSPI_HREQ.

Enum.name: HRSEL_1
Enum.description: Host request input is input trigger.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_0
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is disabled.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_1
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is enabled.

Enum.name: RDMO_0
Enum.description: Received data is stored in the receive FIFO as normal.

Enum.name: RDMO_1
Enum.description: Received data is discarded unless the DMF is set.

Enum.name: MASTER_0
Enum.description: Slave mode.

Enum.name: MASTER_1
Enum.description: Master mode.

Enum.name: SAMPLE_0
Enum.description: Input data sampled on SCK edge.

Enum.name: SAMPLE_1
Enum.description: Input data sampled on delayed SCK edge.

Enum.name: AUTOPCS_0
Enum.description: Automatic PCS generation disabled.

Enum.name: AUTOPCS_1
Enum.description: Automatic PCS generation enabled.

Enum.name: NOSTALL_0
Enum.description: Transfers will stall when transmit FIFO is empty or receive FIFO is full.

Enum.name: NOSTALL_1
Enum.description: Transfers will not stall, allowing transmit FIFO underrun or receive FIFO overrun to occur.

Enum.name: PCSPOL_0
Enum.description: The PCSx is active low.

Enum.name: PCSPOL_1
Enum.description: The PCSx is active high.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match disabled.

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: PINCFG_0
Enum.description: SIN is used for input data and SOUT for output data.

Enum.name: PINCFG_1
Enum.description: SIN is used for both input and output data.

Enum.name: TOS_0

Enum.name: ERR_0
Enum.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

Enum.name: ERR_1
Enum.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Enum.description: Timer will stop after timeout and will restart after rising edge on the T_EN bit is detected (i.e. timer channel is disabled and then enabled)

Enum.name: FTMEN_0
Enum.description: TPM compatibility. Free running counter and synchronization compatible with TPM.

Enum.name: FTMEN_1
Enum.description: Free running counter and synchronization are different from TPM behavior.

Enum.name: WPDIS_0
Enum.description: Write protection is enabled.

Enum.name: WPDIS_1
Enum.description: Write protection is disabled.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_0
Enum.description: No restrictions. Software and hardware triggers can be used by MOD, CnV, OUTMASK, and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_1
Enum.description: Software trigger can only be used by MOD and CnV synchronization, and hardware triggers can only be used by OUTMASK and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_0
Enum.description: Capture test mode is disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_1
Enum.description: Capture test mode is enabled.

Enum.name: FAULTM_0
Enum.description: Fault control is disabled for all channels.

Enum.name: FAULTM_1
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for even channels only (channels 0, 2, 4, and 6), and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_2
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_3
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the automatic fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_0
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_1
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMIN_0
Enum.description: The minimum loading point is disabled.

Enum.name: CNTMIN_1
Enum.description: The minimum loading point is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_0
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is disabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_1
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is enabled.

BitField.name: REINIT
BitField.description: FTM Counter Reinitialization By Synchronization (FTM counter synchronization)

Enum.name: REINIT_0
Enum.description: FTM counter continues to count normally.

Enum.name: REINIT_1
Enum.description: FTM counter is updated with its initial value when the selected trigger is detected.

Enum.name: SYNCHOM_0
Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer in all rising edges of the FTM input clock.

Enum.name: SYNCHOM_1
Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer only by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.description: No fault condition was detected at the fault input.

Enum.name: FAULTF2_1
Enum.description: A fault condition was detected at the fault input.

Enum.name: FAULTF3_0
Enum.description: No fault condition was detected at the fault input.

Enum.name: FAULTF3_1
Enum.description: A fault condition was detected at the fault input.

Enum.name: FAULTIN_0
Enum.description: The logic OR of the enabled fault inputs is 0.

Enum.name: FAULTIN_1
Enum.description: The logic OR of the enabled fault inputs is 1.

Enum.name: WPEN_0
Enum.description: Write protection is disabled. Write protected bits can be written.

Enum.name: WPEN_1
Enum.description: Write protection is enabled. Write protected bits cannot be written.

Enum.name: FAULTF_0
Enum.description: No fault condition was detected.

Enum.name: FAULTF_1
Enum.description: A fault condition was detected.

Enum.description: Fault input is disabled.

Enum.name: FAULT0EN_1
Enum.description: Fault input is enabled.

Enum.name: FAULT1EN_1

Enum.description: Fault input is disabled.

Enum.name: FAULT3EN_1
Enum.description: Fault input is enabled.

Enum.name: FFLTR0EN_0
Enum.description: Fault input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: FFLTR0EN_1
Enum.description: Fault input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: FFLTR1EN_0
Enum.description: Fault input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: FFLTR1EN_1
Enum.description: Fault input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: FFLTR2EN_0
Enum.description: Fault input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: FFLTR2EN_1
Enum.description: Fault input filter is enabled.

Enum.description: Fault input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: FFLTR3EN_1

Enum.name: FSTATE_0
Enum.description: FTM outputs will be placed into safe values when fault events in ongoing (defined by POL bits).

Enum.name: FSTATE_1
Enum.description: FTM outputs will be tri-stated when fault event is ongoing

Enum.name: QUADEN_0
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is disabled.

Enum.name: QUADEN_1
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is enabled.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEEN_0
Enum.description: Use of an external global time base is disabled.

Enum.name: GTBEEN_1
Enum.description: Use of an external global time base is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_0
Enum.description: A global time base signal generation is disabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_1
Enum.description: A global time base signal generation is enabled.

Enum.name: ITRIGR_0
Enum.description: Initialization trigger is generated on counter wrap events.

Enum.name: ITRIGR_1
Enum.description: Initialization trigger is generated when a reload point is reached.

Enum.name: FLT0POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT0POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT1POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT1POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT2POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT2POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT3POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT3POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: HWTRIGMODE_0
Enum.description: FTM clears the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: HWTRIGMODE_1
Enum.description: FTM does not clear the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: CNTINC_0
Enum.description: CNTIN register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: CNTINC_1
Enum.description: CNTIN register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: INVC_0
Enum.description: INVCTRL register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: INVC_1
Enum.description: INVCTRL register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: SWOC_0
Enum.description: SWOCTRL register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: SWOC_1
Enum.description: SWOCTRL register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: SYNCMODE_0

Enum.name: SYNCMODE_1
Enum.description: Enhanced PWM synchronization is selected.

Enum.name: CHF_0
Enum.description: No channel (n) event has occurred.

Enum.name: CHF_1
Enum.description: A channel (n) event has occurred.

Enum.name: TRIGMODE_0
Enum.description: Channel outputs will generate the normal PWM outputs without generating a pulse.

Enum.name: TRIGMODE_1
Enum.description: If a match in the channel occurs, a trigger generation on channel output will happen. The trigger pulse width has one FTM clock cycle.

Enum.name: CHIS_0
Enum.description: The channel (n) input is zero.

Enum.name: CHIS_1
Enum.description: The channel (n) input is one.

Enum.name: DMA_0
Enum.description: Disable DMA transfers.

Enum.name: DMA_1
Enum.description: Enable DMA transfers.

BitField.name: ICRST
BitField.description: FTM counter reset by the selected input capture event.

Enum.description: FTM counter is not reset when the selected channel (n) input event is detected.

Enum.name: ICRST_1
Enum.description: FTM counter is reset when the selected channel (n) input event is detected.

Enum.name: CHIE_0
Enum.description: Disable channel (n) interrupt. Use software polling.

Enum.name: CHIE_1
Enum.description: Enable channel (n) interrupt.

Enum.description: No channel (n) event has occurred.

Enum.name: CHF_1
Enum.description: A channel (n) event has occurred.

Enum.name: TRIGMODE_1

Enum.name: CHIS_0

Enum.name: CHIS_1
Enum.description: The channel (n) input is one.

Enum.name: FTMEN_1

Enum.name: WPDIS_0
Enum.description: Write protection is enabled.

Enum.name: WPDIS_1
Enum.description: Write protection is disabled.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_0
Enum.description: No restrictions. Software and hardware triggers can be used by MOD, CnV, OUTMASK, and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_1
Enum.description: Software trigger can only be used by MOD and CnV synchronization, and hardware triggers can only be used by OUTMASK and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_0
Enum.description: Capture test mode is disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_1
Enum.description: Capture test mode is enabled.

Enum.name: FAULTM_0
Enum.description: Fault control is disabled for all channels.

Enum.name: FAULTM_1
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for even channels only (channels 0, 2, 4, and 6), and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_2
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_3
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the automatic fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_0
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_1
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMIN_0

Enum.name: CNTMIN_1
Enum.description: The minimum loading point is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_0
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is disabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_1
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is enabled.

BitField.name: REINIT
BitField.description: FTM Counter Reinitialization By Synchronization (FTM counter synchronization)

Enum.name: REINIT_0
Enum.description: FTM counter continues to count normally.

Enum.name: REINIT_1
Enum.description: FTM counter is updated with its initial value when the selected trigger is detected.

Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer in all rising edges of the FTM input clock.

Enum.name: SYNCHOM_1
Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer only by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: QUADEN_0
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is disabled.

Enum.name: QUADEN_1
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is enabled.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEEN_0
Enum.description: Use of an external global time base is disabled.

Enum.name: GTBEEN_1
Enum.description: Use of an external global time base is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_0
Enum.description: A global time base signal generation is disabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_1
Enum.description: A global time base signal generation is enabled.

Enum.name: ITRIGR_0
Enum.description: Initialization trigger is generated on counter wrap events.

Enum.name: ITRIGR_1
Enum.description: Initialization trigger is generated when a reload point is reached.

Enum.name: FLT0POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT3POL_1

Enum.name: HWTRIGMODE_0
Enum.description: FTM clears the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: HWTRIGMODE_1
Enum.description: FTM does not clear the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: CNTINC_0
Enum.description: CNTIN register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: CNTINC_1
Enum.description: CNTIN register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: INVC_0
Enum.description: INVCTRL register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: INVC_1
Enum.description: INVCTRL register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: SWOC_0
Enum.description: SWOCTRL register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: SWOC_1
Enum.description: SWOCTRL register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: SYNCMODE_0
Enum.description: Legacy PWM synchronization is selected.

Enum.name: SYNCMODE_1
Enum.description: Enhanced PWM synchronization is selected.

Enum.name: SWRSTCNT_0
Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate the FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: SWRSTCNT_1
Enum.description: The software trigger activates the FTM counter synchronization.

BitField.name: SWWRBUF

Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate MOD, HCR, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization.

Enum.name: SWWRBUF_1
Enum.description: The software trigger activates MOD, HCR, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization.

Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate the OUTMASK register synchronization.

Enum.name: SWOM_1

Enum.name: SWINVC_1

Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate the SWOCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: SWSOC_1

Enum.description: A hardware trigger does not activate the OUTMASK register synchronization.

Enum.name: HWOM_1
Enum.description: A hardware trigger activates the OUTMASK register synchronization.

Enum.name: HWINVC_0
Enum.description: A hardware trigger does not activate the INVCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: HWINVC_1
Enum.description: A hardware trigger activates the INVCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: QUADEN_1
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is enabled.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: HWTRIGMODE_1
Enum.description: FTM does not clear the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: AVGE_0

Enum.name: AVGE_1
Enum.description: Hardware average function enabled.

Enum.description: Continuous conversions will be performed (or continuous sets of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

Enum.name: TCR_0
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32768 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_1
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32767 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_127
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32641 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_128
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32896 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_255
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32769 clock cycles.

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: Resets all RTC registers except for the SWR bit and the RTC_WAR and RTC_RAR registers . The SWR bit is cleared by POR and by software explicitly clearing it.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin is enabled and wakeup pin asserts if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.

Enum.name: NON_SUPPORTED
Enum.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are not supported and generate a bus error.

Enum.name: SUPPORTED
Enum.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are supported.

Enum.name: PROTECTED
Enum.description: Registers cannot be written when locked.

Enum.name: WRITEABLE
Enum.description: Registers can be written when locked under limited conditions.

Enum.name: ASSERTED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin asserts (active low, open drain) if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.

Enum.name: RTC_32KHZ
Enum.description: Wakeup pin instead outputs the RTC 32kHz clock, provided the wakeup pin is turned on and the 32kHz clock is output to other peripherals.

Enum.name: PRESCALER
Enum.description: The prescaler output clock (as configured by TSIC) is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: The RTC 32kHz crystal clock is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: RTC prescaler increments using 32 kHz crystal.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: RTC prescaler increments using LPO, bits [4:0] of the prescaler are bypassed.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is enabled. After setting this bit, wait the oscillator startup time before enabling the time counter to allow the 32.768 kHz clock time to stabilize.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The 32 kHz clock is allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The 32 kHz clock is not allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RTC_CLKOUT is disabled.

Enum.name: RTC_PTE0
Enum.description: RTC_CLKOUT is enabled.

Enum.name: VALID
Enum.description: Time is valid.

Enum.name: INVALID
Enum.description: Time is invalid and time counter is read as zero.

Enum.name: NOT_OCCURED
Enum.description: Time overflow has not occurred.

Enum.name: OCCURED
Enum.description: Time overflow has occurred and time counter is read as zero.

Enum.name: NOT_OCCURED
Enum.description: Time alarm has not occurred.

Enum.name: OCCURED
Enum.description: Time alarm has occurred.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time counter is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time counter is enabled.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Time Compensation Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Time Compensation Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Control Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Control Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Status Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Status Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Lock Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Lock Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time invalid flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time invalid flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time overflow flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time overflow flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time alarm flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time alarm flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Seconds interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Seconds interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: If the wakeup pin is enabled, then the wakeup pin will assert.

Enum.name: F1HZ
Enum.description: 1 Hz.

Enum.name: F2HZ
Enum.description: 2 Hz.

Enum.name: F4HZ
Enum.description: 4 Hz.

Enum.name: F8HZ
Enum.description: 8 Hz.

Enum.name: F16HZ
Enum.description: 16 Hz.

Enum.name: F32HZ
Enum.description: 32 Hz.

Enum.name: F64HZ
Enum.description: 64 Hz.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Seconds Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Seconds Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Prescaler Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Prescaler Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Alarm Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Alarm Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Compensation Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Compensation Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Control Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Control Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Status Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Status Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Lock Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Lock Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Interupt Enable Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Interrupt Enable Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Seconds Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Seconds Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Pprescaler Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Prescaler Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Alarm Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Alarm Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Compensation Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Reads to the Time Compensation Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Reads to the Control Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Reads to the Control Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Reads to the Status Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Reads to the Status Register complete as normal.

Enum.description: Reads to the Lock Register are ignored.

Register.name: LPTMR0_CSR
Register.description: Low Power Timer Control Status Register

Enum.name: TEN_0
Enum.description: LPTMR is disabled and internal logic is reset.

Enum.name: TEN_1
Enum.description: LPTMR is enabled.

Enum.name: TMS_0
Enum.description: Time Counter mode.

Enum.name: TMS_1
Enum.description: Pulse Counter mode.

Enum.name: TFC_0
Enum.description: CNR is reset whenever TCF is set.

Enum.name: TFC_1
Enum.description: CNR is reset on overflow.

Enum.name: TPP_0
Enum.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-high, and the CNR will increment on the rising-edge.

Enum.name: TPP_1
Enum.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-low, and the CNR will increment on the falling-edge.

Enum.name: TPS_0
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 0 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_1
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 1 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_2
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 2 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_3
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 3 is selected.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Timer interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Timer interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TCF_0
Enum.description: The value of CNR is not equal to CMR and increments.

Enum.name: TCF_1
Enum.description: The value of CNR is equal to CMR and increments.

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Timer DMA Request disabled.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Timer DMA Request enabled.

Enum.name: PCS_0
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 0 selected.

Enum.name: PCS_1
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 1 selected.

Enum.name: PCS_2
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 2 selected.

Enum.name: PCS_3
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 3 selected.

Enum.name: PBYP_0
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PBYP_1
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter is bypassed.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_0
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2; glitch filter does not support this configuration.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_1
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_2
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_3
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_4
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_5
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 64; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_6
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 128; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 64 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_7
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 256; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 128 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_8
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 512; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 256 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_9
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 1024; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 512 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_10
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2048; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 1024 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_11
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4096; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2048 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_12
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8192; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4096 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_13
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16,384; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8192 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_14
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32,768; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16,384 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_15
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 65,536; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32,768 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: No interleave channel

Enum.name: DIV1
Enum.description: Divided by 1

Enum.name: DIV2
Enum.description: Divided by 2

Enum.name: DIV4
Enum.description: Divided by 4

Enum.name: DIV8
Enum.description: Divided by 8

Enum.name: DOWN

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: NOT_LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are not locked.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are locked and cannot be updated until the next system reset.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

Enum.name: DMA_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

Enum.name: DMA_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: UP
Enum.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: ANA_DIS
Enum.description: Pin disabled (Alternative 0) (analog).

Enum.description: Alternative 1 (GPIO).

Enum.name: NOT_LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are not locked.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are locked and cannot be updated until the next system reset.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

Enum.name: DMA_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: BUS
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the bus clock.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the LPO clock.

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: UP
Enum.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: ANA_DIS
Enum.description: Pin disabled (Alternative 0) (analog).

Enum.description: Alternative 1 (GPIO).

Enum.name: NOT_LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are not locked.

Enum.name: LOCKED

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

Enum.name: DMA_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: LOCKED

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING

Enum.name: INT_FALLING

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING

Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: UP
Enum.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: BUS
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the bus clock.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the LPO clock.

Enum.name: STOP_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: DBG_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: DBG_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: TST_0
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode disabled.

Enum.name: TST_1
Enum.description: Watchdog user mode enabled. (Watchdog test mode disabled.) After testing the watchdog, software should use this setting to indicate that the watchdog is functioning normally in user mode.

Enum.name: TST_2
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the low byte is used. CNT[CNTLOW] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALLOW].

Enum.name: TST_3
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the high byte is used. CNT[CNTHIGH] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALHIGH].

Enum.name: UPDATE_0
Enum.description: Updates not allowed. After the initial configuration, the watchdog cannot be later modified without forcing a reset.

Enum.name: UPDATE_1
Enum.description: Updates allowed. Software can modify the watchdog configuration registers within 128 bus clocks after performing the unlock write sequence.

Enum.name: INT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are disabled. Watchdog resets are not delayed.

Enum.name: INT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are enabled. Watchdog resets are delayed by 128 bus clocks from the interrupt vector fetch.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled.

Enum.name: CLK_0
Enum.description: Bus clock

Enum.name: CLK_1
Enum.description: LPO clock

Enum.name: CLK_2
Enum.description: System oscillator clock (SOSC, from SCG)

Enum.name: CLK_3
Enum.description: Slow internal reference clock (SIRC, from SCG)

Enum.name: RCS_0
Enum.description: Reconfiguring WDOG.

Enum.name: RCS_1
Enum.description: Reconfiguration is successful.

Enum.name: ULK_0
Enum.description: WDOG is locked.

Enum.name: ULK_1
Enum.description: WDOG is unlocked.

Enum.name: PRES_0
Enum.description: 256 prescaler disabled.

Enum.name: PRES_1
Enum.description: 256 prescaler enabled.

BitField.name: CMD32EN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (otherwise 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

Enum.name: CMD32EN_0
Enum.description: Disables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. Only 16-bit or 8-bit is supported.

Enum.name: CMD32EN_1
Enum.description: Enables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. 16-bit or 8-bit is NOT supported.

Enum.name: FLG_0
Enum.description: No interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: FLG_1
Enum.description: An interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: WIN_0
Enum.description: Window mode disabled.

Enum.name: WIN_1
Enum.description: Window mode enabled.

BitField.name: CNTLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: CNTHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: TOVALLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the timeout value

BitField.name: TOVALHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the timeout value

Register.name: PWT_CS
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Control and Status Register

Enum.name: PWTOV_0
Enum.description: PWT counter no overflow.

Enum.name: PWTOV_1
Enum.description: PWT counter runs from 0xFFFF to 0x0000.

Enum.name: PWTRDY_0
Enum.description: PWT pulse width register(s) is not up-to-date.

Enum.name: PWTRDY_1
Enum.description: PWT pulse width register(s) has been updated.

BitField.name: FCTLE
BitField.description: First counter load enable after enable

Enum.name: FCTLE_0
Enum.description: Do not load the first counter values to corresponding registers

Enum.name: FCTLE_1
Enum.description: Load the first coutner value to corresponding registers depended by the PWTIN level

Enum.name: PWTSR_0
Enum.description: No action taken.

Enum.name: PWTSR_1
Enum.description: Writing 1 to this field will perform soft reset to PWT.

Enum.name: POVIE_0
Enum.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

Enum.name: POVIE_1
Enum.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

BitField.name: PRDYIE
BitField.description: PWT Pulse Width Data Ready Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: PRDYIE_0
Enum.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

Enum.name: PRDYIE_1
Enum.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

Enum.name: PWTIE_0
Enum.description: Disables the PWT to generate interrupt.

Enum.name: PWTIE_1
Enum.description: Enables the PWT to generate interrupt.

Enum.name: PWTEN_0
Enum.description: The PWT is disabled.

Enum.name: PWTEN_1
Enum.description: The PWT is enabled.

Enum.name: PRE_0
Enum.description: Clock divided by 1.

Enum.name: PRE_1
Enum.description: Clock divided by 2.

Enum.name: PRE_2
Enum.description: Clock divided by 4.

Enum.name: PRE_3
Enum.description: Clock divided by 8.

Enum.name: PRE_4
Enum.description: Clock divided by 16.

Enum.name: PRE_5
Enum.description: Clock divided by 32.

Enum.name: PRE_6
Enum.description: Clock divided by 64.

Enum.name: PRE_7
Enum.description: Clock divided by 128.

BitField.name: TGL
BitField.description: PWTIN states Toggled from last state

Enum.name: TGL_0
Enum.description: The selected PWTIN hasn't changed its original states from last time.

Enum.name: TGL_1
Enum.description: The selected PWTIN has toggled its states.

Enum.name: PINSEL_0
Enum.description: PWTIN[0] is enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_1
Enum.description: PWTIN[1] is enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_2
Enum.description: PWTIN[2] enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_3
Enum.description: PWTIN[3] enabled.

Enum.name: PCLKS_0
Enum.description: BUS_CLK is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

Enum.name: PCLKS_1
Enum.description: Alternative clock is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

Register.name: PWT_PPH
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: High

Register.name: PWT_PPL
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: Loq

Register.name: PWT_NPH
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: High

Register.name: PWT_NPL
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: Low

Register.name: PWT_CNTH
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: High

Register.name: PWT_CNTL
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: Low

RegisterGroup.name: FLEXIO
RegisterGroup.description: Flexible I/O - universal I/O module for communication (UART, SPI, I2C, I2S) and PWM purposes.

Enum.name: FEATURE_0
Enum.description: Standard features implemented.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Supports state, logic and parallel modes.

Enum.name: FLEXEN_0
Enum.description: FlexIO module is disabled.

Enum.name: FLEXEN_1
Enum.description: FlexIO module is enabled.

Enum.name: SWRST_0
Enum.description: Software reset is disabled

Enum.name: SWRST_1
Enum.description: Software reset is enabled, all FlexIO registers except the Control Register are reset.

Enum.name: FASTACC_0
Enum.description: Configures for normal register accesses to FlexIO

Enum.name: FASTACC_1
Enum.description: Configures for fast register accesses to FlexIO

Enum.name: DBGE_0
Enum.description: FlexIO is disabled in debug modes.

Enum.name: DBGE_1
Enum.description: FlexIO is enabled in debug modes

Enum.name: DOZEN_0
Enum.description: FlexIO enabled in Doze modes.

Enum.name: DOZEN_1
Enum.description: FlexIO disabled in Doze modes.

Enum.name: SSF_0
Enum.description: Status flag is clear

Enum.name: SSF_1
Enum.description: Status flag is set

Enum.name: SEF_0
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag is clear

Enum.name: SEF_1
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag is set

Enum.name: TSF_0
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag is clear

Enum.name: TSF_1
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag is set

Enum.name: SSIE_0
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag interrupt disabled

Enum.name: SSIE_1
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SEIE_0
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag interrupt disabled

Enum.name: SEIE_1
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag interrupt enabled

Enum.name: TEIE_0
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag interrupt is disabled

Enum.name: TEIE_1
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag interrupt is enabled

Enum.name: SSDE_0
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag DMA request is disabled

Enum.name: SSDE_1
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag DMA request is enabled

Enum.name: SMOD_1
Enum.description: Receive mode. Captures the current Shifter content into the SHIFTBUF on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_2
Enum.description: Transmit mode. Load SHIFTBUF contents into the Shifter on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_4
Enum.description: Match Store mode. Shifter data is compared to SHIFTBUF content on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_5
Enum.description: Match Continuous mode. Shifter data is continuously compared to SHIFTBUF contents.
