BitField.name: ROSCEREFS
BitField.description: RTC 32k Oscillator external reference clcok selection

Enum.name: EXTERNAL
Enum.description: Bypass mode. RTC oscillator selects the external 32k clock.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: Crystal mode.

Enum.name: STABLE
Enum.description: RTC 32k oscillator is unstable now and no clock will go out of the block.

Enum.name: UNSTABLE
Enum.description: RTC 32k oscillator is stable.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is disabled regardless the state of ROSCEN.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is enabled in Stop mode when ROSCEN is set.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is enabled.

BitField.name: SERVICE
BitField.description: The EWM refresh mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

BitField.name: COMPAREL
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum refresh time is required

BitField.name: COMPAREH
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum refresh time is required

BitField.name: CLK_DIV
BitField.description: Selected low power clock source for running the EWM counter can be prescaled as below

Enum.name: LK_0

Enum.description: Register cannot be written until the next system Reset.

Register.name: SCG_LPFLLCSR
Register.description: Low Power FLL Control Status Register

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: LPFLL is disabled

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: LPFLL is enabled

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Disable trimming LPFLL to an reference clock source

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Enable trimming LPFLL to an reference clock source

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Disable LPFLL trimming updates. LPFLL frequency determined by AUTOTRIM written value.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Enable LPFLL trimming updates. LPFLL frequency determined by reference clock multiplication

Enum.name: UNLOCKED
Enum.description: LPFLL not Locked

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: LPFLL trimmed and Locked

Enum.name: LPFLLCM_0
Enum.description: LPFLL Clock Monitor is disabled

Enum.name: LPFLLCM_1
Enum.description: LPFLL Clock Monitor is enabled

Enum.name: LPFLLCMRE_0
Enum.description: Clock Monitor generates interrupt when error detected

Enum.name: LPFLLCMRE_1
Enum.description: Clock Monitor generates reset when error detected

Enum.name: WRITTEN
Enum.description: Control Status Register can be written.

Enum.name: PROTECTED
Enum.description: Control Status Register cannot be written.

Enum.name: LPFLLVLD_0
Enum.description: LPFLL is not enabled or clock is not valid.

Enum.name: LPFLLVLD_1
Enum.description: LPFLL is enabled and output clock is valid.

Enum.name: NOT_SYSTEM
Enum.description: LPFLL is not the system clock source

Enum.name: SYSTEM
Enum.description: LPFLL is the system clock source

Enum.name: NOT_ERROR
Enum.description: Error not detected with the LPFLL trimming.

Enum.name: ERROR
Enum.description: Error detected with the LPFLL trimming.

Enum.description: Output disabled

Enum.name: FEATURE_2
Enum.description: Master only with standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Master and slave with standard feature set.

Enum.name: MEN_0
Enum.description: Master logic is disabled.

Enum.name: MEN_1
Enum.description: Master logic is enabled.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Master logic is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Master logic is reset.

Enum.name: DOZEN_0
Enum.description: Master is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEN_1
Enum.description: Master is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_0
Enum.description: Master is disabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_1
Enum.description: Master is enabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: RTF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RTF_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: RRF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RRF_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: TDF_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not requested.

Enum.name: TDF_1
Enum.description: Transmit data is requested.

Enum.name: RDF_0
Enum.description: Receive Data is not ready.

BitField.name: IGNACK
BitField.description: When set, the received NACK field is ignored and assumed to be ACK

Enum.name: IGNACK_0
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will receive ACK and NACK normally.

Enum.name: IGNACK_1
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will treat a received NACK as if it was an ACK.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_0
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if SCL is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_1
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if either SCL or SDA is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match disabled.

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: RXCFG_0
Enum.description: Reading the receive data register will return receive data and clear the receive data flag.

Enum.name: BEF_0
Enum.description: Slave has not detected a bit error.

Enum.name: BEF_1
Enum.description: Slave has detected a bit error.

Enum.name: FEF_0
Enum.description: FIFO underflow or overflow not detected.

Enum.name: FEF_1
Enum.description: FIFO underflow or overflow detected.

Enum.name: AM0F_0

Enum.name: AM0F_1
Enum.description: Have received ADDR0 matching address.

Enum.name: AM1F_0
Enum.description: Have not received ADDR1 or ADDR0/ADDR1 range matching address.

Enum.name: AM1F_1
Enum.description: Have received ADDR1 or ADDR0/ADDR1 range matching address.

Enum.name: GCF_0
Enum.description: Slave has not detected the General Call Address or General Call Address disabled.

Enum.name: GCF_1
Enum.description: Slave has detected the General Call Address.

Enum.name: SARF_0
Enum.description: SMBus Alert Response disabled or not detected.

Enum.name: SARF_1
Enum.description: SMBus Alert Response enabled and detected.

Enum.name: SBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Slave is idle.

Enum.name: SBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Slave is busy.

Enum.name: BBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Bus is idle.

Enum.name: BBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Bus is busy.

Enum.name: TDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled

Enum.name: RDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: AVDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: AVDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: ADRSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: ADRSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: RXSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: RXSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: TXDSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: TXDSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: ACKSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: ACKSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: GCEN_0
Enum.description: General Call address is disabled.

Enum.name: GCEN_1
Enum.description: General call address is enabled.

Enum.name: SAEN_0
Enum.description: Disables match on SMBus Alert.

Enum.name: SAEN_1
Enum.description: Enables match on SMBus Alert.

Enum.name: TXCFG_0
Enum.description: Transmit Data Flag will only assert during a slave-transmit transfer when the transmit data register is empty.

Enum.name: TXCFG_1
Enum.description: Transmit Data Flag will assert whenever the transmit data register is empty.

Enum.name: RXCFG_0
Enum.description: Reading the receive data register will return receive data and clear the receive data flag.

Enum.name: RXCFG_1
Enum.description: Reading the receive data register when the address valid flag is set will return the address status register and clear the address valid flag. Reading the receive data register when the address valid flag is clear will return receive data and clear the receive data flag.

Enum.name: IGNACK_0
Enum.description: Slave will end transfer when NACK detected.

Enum.name: IGNACK_1
Enum.description: Slave will not end transfer when NACK detected.

Enum.name: HSMEN_0
Enum.description: Disables detection of Hs-mode master code.

Enum.name: HSMEN_1
Enum.description: Enables detection of Hs-mode master code.

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_0
Enum.description: Address match 0 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_1
Enum.description: Address match 0 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_2
Enum.description: Address match 0 (7-bit) or Address match 1 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_3
Enum.description: Address match 0 (10-bit) or Address match 1 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_4
Enum.description: Address match 0 (7-bit) or Address match 1 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_5
Enum.description: Address match 0 (10-bit) or Address match 1 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_6
Enum.description: From Address match 0 (7-bit) to Address match 1 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_7
Enum.description: From Address match 0 (10-bit) to Address match 1 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ANV_0
Enum.description: RADDR is valid.

Enum.name: ANV_1
Enum.description: RADDR is not valid.

Enum.name: TXNACK_0
Enum.description: Transmit ACK for received word.

Enum.name: TXNACK_1
Enum.description: Transmit NACK for received word.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_0
Enum.description: The Receive Data Register is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_1
Enum.description: The Receive Data Register is empty.

Enum.name: SOF_0
Enum.description: Indicates this is not the first data word since a (repeated) START or STOP condition.

Enum.name: SOF_1
Enum.description: Indicates this is the first data word since a (repeated) START or STOP condition.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1

Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0

Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

BitField.name: HYSTCTR
BitField.description: Comparator hard block hysteresis control. See chip data sheet to get the actual hystersis value with each level

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_0
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 0 hysteresis internally.

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_1
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 1 hysteresis internally.

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_2
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 2 hysteresis internally.

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_3
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 3 hysteresis internally.

BitField.name: OFFSET
BitField.description: Comparator hard block offset control. See chip data sheet to get the actual offset value with each level

Enum.name: OFFSET_0
Enum.description: The comparator hard block output has level 0 offset internally.

Enum.name: OFFSET_1
Enum.description: The comparator hard block output has level 1 offset internally.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_0
Enum.description: Filter is disabled. If SE = 1, then COUT is a logic zero (this is not a legal state, and is not recommended). If SE = 0, COUT = COUTA.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_1
Enum.description: 1 consecutive sample must agree (comparator output is simply sampled).

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_2
Enum.description: 2 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_3
Enum.description: 3 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_4
Enum.description: 4 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_5
Enum.description: 5 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_6
Enum.description: 6 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_7
Enum.description: 7 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: Analog Comparator is disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1
Enum.description: Analog Comparator is enabled.

Enum.name: OPE_0
Enum.description: When OPE is 0, the comparator output (after window/filter settings dependent on software configuration) is not available to a packaged pin.

Enum.name: OPE_1
Enum.description: When OPE is 1, and if the software has configured the comparator to own a packaged pin, the comparator is available in a packaged pin.

Enum.name: COS_0
Enum.description: Set CMPO to equal COUT (filtered comparator output).

Enum.name: COS_1
Enum.description: Set CMPO to equal COUTA (unfiltered comparator output).

Enum.name: INVT_0
Enum.description: Does not invert the comparator output.

Enum.name: INVT_1
Enum.description: Inverts the comparator output.

Enum.name: PMODE_0
Enum.description: Low Speed (LS) comparison mode is selected.

Enum.name: PMODE_1
Enum.description: High Speed (HS) comparison mode is selected, in VLPx mode, or Stop mode switched to Low Speed (LS) mode.

Enum.name: WE_0
Enum.description: Windowing mode is not selected.

Enum.name: WE_1
Enum.description: Windowing mode is selected.

Enum.name: SE_0
Enum.description: Sampling mode is not selected.

Enum.name: SE_1
Enum.description: Sampling mode is selected.

Enum.name: CFF_0
Enum.description: A falling edge has not been detected on COUT.

Enum.name: CFF_1
Enum.description: A falling edge on COUT has occurred.

Enum.name: CFR_0
Enum.description: A rising edge has not been detected on COUT.

Enum.name: CFR_1
Enum.description: A rising edge on COUT has occurred.

Enum.name: IEF_0
Enum.description: Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: IEF_1
Enum.description: Interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: IER_0
Enum.description: Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: IER_1
Enum.description: Interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: DMA is disabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA is enabled.

Enum.name: VRSEL_0
Enum.description: Vin1 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

Enum.name: VRSEL_1
Enum.description: Vin2 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

Enum.name: DACEN_0
Enum.description: DAC is disabled.

Enum.name: DACEN_1
Enum.description: DAC is enabled.

BitField.name: INNSEL
BitField.description: Selection of the input to the negative port of the comparator

Enum.name: INNSEL_0
Enum.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

Enum.name: INNSEL_1
Enum.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

BitField.name: INPSEL
BitField.description: Selection of the input to the positive port of the comparator

Enum.name: INPSEL_0
Enum.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

Enum.name: INPSEL_1
Enum.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

Enum.name: DACOE_0
Enum.description: DAC output is disabled to go outside.

Enum.name: DACOE_1
Enum.description: DAC output is enabled to go outside.

BitField.name: ACOn
BitField.description: The result of the input comparison for channel n

BitField.name: INITMOD
BitField.description: Comparator and DAC initialization delay modulus.

Enum.name: INITMOD_0
Enum.description: The modulus is set to 64(same with 111111).

Enum.name: NSAM_0
Enum.description: The comparison result is sampled as soon as the active channel is scanned in one round-robin clock.

Enum.name: NSAM_1
Enum.description: The sampling takes place 1 round-robin clock cycle after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.name: NSAM_2
Enum.description: The sampling takes place 2 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.name: NSAM_3
Enum.description: The sampling takes place 3 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_0

Enum.description: Channel 7 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.description: The Minus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Plus port are swept in each round.

Enum.description: The round-robin interrupt is disabled.

Register.name: PMC_LVDSC1
Register.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 1 Register

Enum.name: LVDRE_0
Enum.description: No system resets on low voltage detect events.

Enum.name: LVDRE_1
Enum.description: If the supply voltage falls below VLVD, a system reset will be generated.

Enum.name: LVDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

Enum.name: LVDIE_1
Enum.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVDF = 1

Enum.name: LVDF_0
Enum.description: Low-voltage event not detected

Enum.name: LVDF_1
Enum.description: Low-voltage event detected

Register.name: PMC_LVDSC2
Register.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 2 Register

Enum.name: LVWIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

Enum.name: LVWIE_1
Enum.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVWF=1

Enum.name: LVWF_0
Enum.description: Low-voltage warning event not detected

Enum.name: LVWF_1
Enum.description: Low-voltage warning event detected

Enum.name: BIASEN_0
Enum.description: Biasing disabled, core logic can run in full performance

Enum.name: BIASEN_1
Enum.description: Biasing enabled, core logic is slower and there are restrictions in allowed system clock speed (see Data Sheet for details)

Enum.name: CLKBIASDIS_0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: CLKBIASDIS_1
Enum.description: In STOP or VLPS mode the bias currents and reference voltages for the following clock modules are disabled: SIRC, FIRC, PLL. (if available on device)

BitField.name: LVD

Enum.description: Reset not caused by LVD trip, HVD trip or POR

Enum.name: LVD_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by LVD trip, HVD trip or POR

Enum.description: Reset not caused by a loss of external clock.

Enum.name: LOC_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by a loss of external clock.

Enum.name: LOL_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by a loss of lock in the PLL/FLL

Enum.name: LOL_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by a loss of lock in the PLL/FLL

Enum.name: WDOG_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by watchdog timeout

Enum.name: WDOG_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by watchdog timeout

Enum.name: PIN_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by external reset pin

Enum.name: PIN_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by external reset pin

Enum.name: POR_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by POR

Enum.name: POR_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by POR

Enum.name: LOCKUP_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by core LOCKUP event

Enum.name: LOCKUP_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by core LOCKUP event

Enum.name: SW_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

Enum.name: SW_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

Enum.name: MDM_AP_1
Enum.description: Reset was caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

Enum.name: SACKERR_0

Enum.description: Reset caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

BitField.name: RSTFLTSRW
BitField.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

Enum.name: RSTFLTSRW_0
Enum.description: All filtering disabled

Enum.name: RSTFLTSRW_1
Enum.description: Bus clock filter enabled for normal operation

Enum.name: RSTFLTSRW_2
Enum.description: LPO clock filter enabled for normal operation

BitField.name: RSTFLTSS
BitField.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

Enum.name: RSTFLTSS_0
Enum.description: All filtering disabled

Enum.name: RSTFLTSS_1
Enum.description: LPO clock filter enabled

BitField.name: RSTFLTSEL
BitField.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

Enum.name: BOOTROM_0
Enum.description: Boot from Flash

Enum.name: BOOTROM_1
Enum.description: Boot from ROM due to BOOTCFG0 pin assertion / Reserved if no Boot pin

Enum.name: BOOTROM_2
Enum.description: Boot form ROM due to FOPT[7] configuration

Enum.name: BOOTROM_3
Enum.description: Boot from ROM due to both BOOTCFG0 pin assertion and FOPT[7] configuration

Enum.name: FORCEROM_0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: FORCEROM_1
Enum.description: Force boot from ROM with RCM_MR[1] set.

Enum.name: FORCEROM_2
Enum.description: Force boot from ROM with RCM_MR[2] set.

Enum.name: FORCEROM_3
Enum.description: Force boot from ROM with RCM_MR[2:1] set.
