BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Enum.name: PENDSTCLR_0
Enum.description: no effect

Enum.name: PENDSTCLR_1
Enum.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

Enum.name: PENDSTSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

Enum.name: PENDSTSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

Enum.name: PENDSVCLR_0
Enum.description: no effect

Enum.name: PENDSVCLR_1
Enum.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

Enum.name: PENDSVSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

Enum.name: PENDSVSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SCB_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.name: SYSRESETREQ_0
Enum.description: no system reset request

Enum.name: SYSRESETREQ_1
Enum.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_0
Enum.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode

Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_1
Enum.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

Enum.name: SLEEPDEEP_1
Enum.description: deep sleep

Enum.name: SEVONPEND_0
Enum.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

Enum.name: SEVONPEND_1
Enum.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Always reads as one, indicates that all unaligned accesses generate a HardFault

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

Register.name: SCB_SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

Enum.name: SVCALLPENDED_0
Enum.description: exception is not pending

Enum.name: SVCALLPENDED_1
Enum.description: exception is pending

Enum.name: HALTED_0
Enum.description: No active halt request debug event

Enum.name: HALTED_1
Enum.description: Halt request debug event active

Enum.name: BKPT_0
Enum.description: No current breakpoint debug event

Enum.name: BKPT_1
Enum.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

Enum.name: DWTTRAP_0
Enum.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT

Enum.name: DWTTRAP_1
Enum.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

Enum.name: VCATCH_0
Enum.description: No Vector catch triggered

Enum.name: VCATCH_1
Enum.description: Vector catch triggered

Enum.name: EXTERNAL_0
Enum.description: No EDBGRQ debug event

Enum.name: EXTERNAL_1
Enum.description: EDBGRQ debug event

Enum.name: ENABLE_0
Enum.description: counter disabled

Enum.name: ENABLE_1
Enum.description: counter enabled

Enum.name: TICKINT_0
Enum.description: counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request

Enum.name: TICKINT_1
Enum.description: counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

Enum.name: CLKSOURCE_0
Enum.description: external clock

Enum.name: CLKSOURCE_1
Enum.description: processor clock

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

Enum.name: SKEW_0
Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is exact

Enum.name: SKEW_1
Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency

Enum.name: NOREF_0
Enum.description: The reference clock is provided

Enum.name: NOREF_1
Enum.description: The reference clock is not provided

Register.name: DHCSR_Read
Register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

BitField.name: C_DEBUGEN
BitField.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

BitField.name: C_HALT
BitField.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_HALT_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_HALT_1
Enum.description: Halt the processor.

BitField.name: C_STEP
BitField.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_STEP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_STEP_1
Enum.description: Step the processor.

BitField.name: C_MASKINTS
BitField.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_0
Enum.description: Do not mask.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_1
Enum.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

BitField.name: S_REGRDY
BitField.description: S_REGRDY bit. A handshake flag for transfers through the DCRDR:- Writing to DCRSR clears the bit to 0.- Completion of the DCRDR transfer then sets the bit to 1.This bit is valid only when the processor is in Debug state, otherwise the bit is UNKNOWN.

Enum.name: S_REGRDY_0
Enum.description: There has been a write to the DCRDR, but the transfer is not complete.

Enum.name: S_REGRDY_1
Enum.description: The transfer to or from the DCRDR is complete.

BitField.name: S_HALT
BitField.description: S_HALT bit. Indicates whether the processor is in Debug state.

Enum.name: S_HALT_0
Enum.description: Not in Debug state.

Enum.name: S_HALT_1
Enum.description: In Debug state.

BitField.name: S_SLEEP
BitField.description: S_SLEEP bit. Indicates whether the processor is sleeping.The debugger must set the C_HALT bit to 1 to gain control, or wait for an interrupt or other wakeup event to wakeup the system.

Enum.name: S_SLEEP_0
Enum.description: Not sleeping.

BitField.name: S_LOCKUP
BitField.description: S_LOCKUP bit. Indicates whether the processor is locked up because of an unrecoverable exception.This bit can only be read as 1 by a remote debugger, using the DAP. The value of 1 indicates that the processor is running but locked up.The bit clears to 0 when the processor enters Debug state.

Enum.name: S_LOCKUP_0
Enum.description: Not locked up

Enum.name: S_LOCKUP_1
Enum.description: Locked up

BitField.name: S_RETIRE_ST
BitField.description: S_RETIRE_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has completed the execution of an instruction since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.A debugger can check this bit to determine if the processor is stalled on a load, store or fetch access.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on or Local reset, but then is set to 1 as soon as the processor executes and retires an instruction.

Enum.name: S_RETIRE_ST_0
Enum.description: No instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

Enum.name: S_RETIRE_ST_1
Enum.description: At least one instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

BitField.name: S_RESET_ST
BitField.description: S_RESET_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has been reset since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.

Enum.name: S_RESET_ST_0
Enum.description: No reset since last DHCSR read.

Enum.name: S_RESET_ST_1
Enum.description: At least one reset since last DHCSR read.

Register.name: DHCSR_Write
Register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

BitField.name: C_DEBUGEN
BitField.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

BitField.name: C_HALT
BitField.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_HALT_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_HALT_1
Enum.description: Halt the processor.

BitField.name: C_STEP
BitField.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_STEP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_STEP_1
Enum.description: Step the processor.

BitField.name: C_MASKINTS
BitField.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_0
Enum.description: Do not mask.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_1
Enum.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

BitField.name: DBGKEY
BitField.description: Debug key:Software must write 0xA05F to this field to enable write accesses to bits [15:0], otherwise the processor ignores the write access.

BitField.name: REGSEL
BitField.description: REGSEL bits. Specifies the ARM core register, special-purpose register, or Floating-point extension register, to transfer.

BitField.name: REGWnR
BitField.description: REGWnR bit. Specifies the access type for the transfer.

BitField.name: DBGTMP
BitField.description: DBGTMP bits. Data temporary cache, for reading and writing the ARM core registers, special-purpose registers, and Floating-point extension registers.The value of this register is UNKNOWN:- on reset- if the processor is in Debug state, the debugger has written to DCRSR since entering Debug state and DHCSR.S_REGRDY is set to 0.

Register.name: DEMCR
Register.description: Debug Exception and Monitor Control Register

BitField.name: VC_CORERESET
BitField.description: VC_CORERESET bit. Enable Reset Vector Catch. This causes a Local reset to halt a running system.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_CORERESET_0
Enum.description: Reset Vector Catch disabled.

Enum.name: VC_CORERESET_1
Enum.description: Reset Vector Catch enabled.

BitField.name: VC_HARDERR
BitField.description: VC_HARDERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a HardFault exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_HARDERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_HARDERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: DWTENA
BitField.description: DWTENA bit. Global enable for all features configured and controlled by the DWT unit.

Enum.name: DWTENA_0
Enum.description: DWT disabled.

Enum.name: DWTENA_1
Enum.description: DWT enabled.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_4
Enum.description: Instruction fetch.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_5
Enum.description: Data operand read.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_6
Enum.description: Data operand write.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_7
Enum.description: Data operand (read + write).

Enum.name: DATAVMATCH_0
Enum.description: Perform address comparison.

Enum.name: DATAVMATCH_1
Enum.description: Perform data value comparison.

Enum.name: MATCHED_0
Enum.description: No match.

Enum.name: MATCHED_1
Enum.description: Match occurred.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_4
Enum.description: Instruction fetch.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_5
Enum.description: Data operand read.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_6
Enum.description: Data operand write.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_7
Enum.description: Data operand (read + write).

Enum.name: MATCHED_0
Enum.description: No match.

Enum.name: MATCHED_1
Enum.description: Match occurred.

Enum.name: ACOMP0_0
Enum.description: Trigger TSTOP based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT0[MATCHED].

Enum.name: ACOMP0_1
Enum.description: Trigger TSTART based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT0[MATCHED].

Enum.name: ACOMP1_0
Enum.description: Trigger TSTOP based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT1[MATCHED].

Enum.name: ACOMP1_1
Enum.description: Trigger TSTART based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT1[MATCHED].

BitField.name: ASC
BitField.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

Enum.name: ASC_0
Enum.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is absent.

Enum.name: ASC_1
Enum.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present.

BitField.name: AMC
BitField.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

Enum.name: AMC_0
Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is absent

Enum.name: AMC_1
Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present

Enum.name: ARB_0
Enum.description: Fixed-priority arbitration for the crossbar masters

Enum.name: ARB_1
Enum.description: Round-robin arbitration for the crossbar masters

Enum.name: DFCDA_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller data caching

Enum.name: DFCDA_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller data caching.

Enum.name: DFCIC_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller instruction caching.

Enum.name: DFCIC_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller instruction caching.

Enum.name: DFCC_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller cache.

Enum.name: DFCC_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller cache.

Enum.name: EFDS_0
Enum.description: Disable flash data speculation.

Enum.name: EFDS_1
Enum.description: Enable flash data speculation.

Enum.name: DFCS_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller speculation.

Enum.name: DFCS_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller speculation.

Enum.name: ESFC_0
Enum.description: Disable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.

Enum.name: ESFC_1
Enum.description: Enable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.

Enum.name: CPOREQ_0
Enum.description: Request is cleared.

Enum.name: CPOREQ_1
Enum.description: Request Compute Operation.

Enum.name: CPOACK_0
Enum.description: Compute operation entry has not completed or compute operation exit has completed.

Enum.name: CPOACK_1
Enum.description: Compute operation entry has completed or compute operation exit has not completed.

Enum.name: CPOWOI_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: CPOWOI_1
Enum.description: When set, the CPOREQ is cleared on any interrupt or exception vector fetch.

Enum.name: SRT_0
Enum.description: No operation initiated

Enum.name: SRT_1
Enum.description: If CSR[DFS] = 1, then initiate a divide calculation, else ignore

Enum.name: USGN_0
Enum.description: Perform a signed divide

Enum.name: USGN_1
Enum.description: Perform an unsigned divide

Enum.name: REM_0
Enum.description: Return the quotient in the RES for the divide calculation

Enum.name: REM_1
Enum.description: Return the remainder in the RES for the divide calculation

Enum.name: DZE_0
Enum.description: Reads of the RES register return the register contents

Enum.name: DZE_1
Enum.description: If CSR[DZ] = 1, an attempted read of RES register is error terminated to signal a divide-by-zero, else the register contents are returned

Enum.name: DZ_0
Enum.description: The last divide operation had a non-zero divisor, that is, DSOR != 0

Enum.name: DZ_1
Enum.description: The last divide operation had a zero divisor, that is, DSOR = 0

Enum.name: DFS_0
Enum.description: A divide operation is initiated by a write to the DSOR register

Enum.name: DFS_1
Enum.description: A divide operation is initiated by a write to the CSR register with CSR[SRT] = 1

Enum.name: SQRT_0
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was not a square root

Enum.name: SQRT_1
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was a square root

Enum.name: DIV_0
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was not a divide

Enum.name: DIV_1
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was a divide

Enum.name: BUSY_0
Enum.description: MMDVSQ is idle

Enum.name: BUSY_1
Enum.description: MMDVSQ is busy performing a divide or square root calculation

Enum.name: PDO_0
Enum.description: Logic level 0 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.

Enum.name: PDO_1
Enum.description: Logic level 1 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.

Enum.name: PTSO_0
Enum.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.

Enum.name: PTSO_1
Enum.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn is set to logic 1.

Enum.name: PTCO_0
Enum.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.

Enum.name: PTCO_1
Enum.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn is cleared to logic 0.

Enum.name: PTTO_0
Enum.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.

Enum.name: PTTO_1
Enum.description: Corresponding bit in PDORn is set to the inverse of its existing logic state.

Enum.name: PDI_0
Enum.description: Pin logic level is logic 0, or is not configured for use by digital function.

Enum.name: PDI_1
Enum.description: Pin logic level is logic 1.

Enum.description: Pin is configured as general-purpose input, for the GPIO function.

Enum.name: PDD_1
Enum.description: Pin is configured as general-purpose output, for the GPIO function.

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register
